title: Calories in One Onion Ring
meta_description: Discover calories in an onion ring, including carbs, fat, protein, sodium, and tweaks for baked or sauced versionsâ€”quick nutrition facts inside.
assumptions: Battered and deep-fried in vegetable oil; average medium size (~10 g raw onion equivalent).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, batter recipe, oil type, and frying method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One fried onion ring contains about 45 kcal, mostly from fat and carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant items.

faqs.q: How many calories in an onion ring?
faqs.a: Approximately 45 kcal for one average fried onion ring.

faqs.q: Are onion rings high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 2.5 g total fat per ring, mainly from frying oil.

faqs.q: What about carbs in onion rings?
faqs.a: Around 5.2 g carbs per ring, mostly from the batter.

faqs.q: Do onion rings have much sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, roughly 110 mg per ring due to seasoning and batter.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in onion rings?
faqs.a: Opt for baked or air-fried versions to cut about 25 kcal per ring.
